: ... I don't-- I'm not-- really sure where to begin, um...
bites her lip. Then just. Blurts out the first question to come to mind. "Did you not want me to be a reaper?"
: ... well... I never want people to become Reapers.

: I know that your home situation was awful and nothing that you would want to go back to, but... I don't... know. I always feel like there could be some way for Players to be able to live the life they deserve-- does that mae sense?
... shakes her head. "I d-don't know what you mean... life they deserve. Doesn't that mean... being happy?"
: Being happy, being able to do whatever they want to do-

pulls her jacket around her a bit more tightly. "... how does... does being a reaper mean I can't do... whatever I want to do, when part of what I wanted to do... was stay here in this... magical world?"
hums, thinking for a moment--
: ... perhaps-- it's different for everyone. Sometimes people can't do what they want to when they are a Reaper.
: But... it seems like you've been able to get enrolled into school, right--?
: Um... not yet, I'm... still w-working on getting accustomed to the environment, an' I gotta get... all the paperwork for a new identity, I was thinking I'd start in the spring for the new term...
: I don't... know what I'd want to do... that I couldn't, now...
: Well... sometimes being a Reaper is the better choice for Players... it seems like it was for you.
: Of course, I'll still be worried for your safety-- it can be very hard, but... now that I think about it, I think you did make the right choice.
tiny... tiny nod. "... is it being a reaper that makes the bad thoughts? Or... or just... being bad?"

very, very fucking quiet voice, tugging her hood down over her eyes. "I want to hurt people. People who... can't fight back. Or who... can, who are... so much stronger but for once in my life I /have/ the power to hurt them, if only a little bit. To... know what it's like to crush and... destroy them. And now I /do/ know, I just... I /know/, and /his/ feelings are there too and I don't know what's me being bad and what's him being bad and... I know it's /bad/... I've been scared to tell you because you didn't want me to be a reaper an' I thought you'd make me leave if you knew... but I don't... know what to do..."
: Mm... why do you want to hurt people if you know its bad?
: I mean... you recognize that it's bad. So you can't be that bad if you're seeing it as bad.
: ... 's exciting. It... feels good. I don't, I don't want to hurt everyone, or most people, or anyone in particular, I ​like​ them... but...
just trails off and whimpers.
: Forgive me for incorrect wording but... considering what you've told me about your life before the game, you didn't have much control over your life, right?
nods. "None." she was kept in a fucking basement
: Then... being able to hurt things-- that's power, in your hands, that you can control.
: That's why it's exciting- control is something you haven't been able to have before.
tiny nod. she taps her Demon's Hatred pin.
: Maybe in your game that was the first time you felt control over something-- fighting noise, right?
: ... yeah. Being... actually... powerful. I didn't... have to hide, the things that hurt me... I hit them back and then they died.
: ... an' then it... I fought Toyo-inu. An' ​you.​ An' you're both... very strong, very powerful, very respected... an' I was able to do damage that you at least felt. Even if it wasn't much.
: An' that was... when I realised... it was fun.
nods... actually looks like he understands.
: ... you know, I had the same thing.
oop hot chocolate is ready goes to prepare it into mugs and comes back, passing a mug to her
clings to the hot chocolate, blinking up at him.
: Have I told you much about my game?

: My entry fee was my self control-- I had a lot of issues with anger management and impulse control when I was younger, but I steadily worked on it over years and was able to get a better grip on it all. So when I played my game, I lost it again.
: So... it was hard for me not to lash out at people, Reapers and Players-- but I found that I could channel it all towards fighting, where that is acceptable--
: I ended up losing my game, and became a Reaper because of it, and because all Reapers hd to erase at least two Players in my old district, it was even more chance to take out that energy--
: ... ended up not being what I wanted at all after I erased my first Player pair-- so I tried to focus that energy elsewhere so something else would give me the same satisfaction.

: That's when I took up a job as a cook. You have to manage yourself pretty calmly to cook well, and when I managed to do it, it felt good to see myself managing my self control-- it's not exactly  the same situation, but... what I'm trying to say is, we can find another way for you to feel tht sense of control that doesn't involve the need to harm people.
... tiny, slow nod. "... I wanna be... a harrier, too, but... outside of that... I dunno what to do at all. 'bout any of this. 'n I'm scared."
: It's hard to figure it all out.
: But you have plenty of time to do that.
: ... mmm, did you say that you could feel Judai's feelings as well?

: ... they got all... dark and scary. It doesn't feel like him anymore. 'f I close my eyes an' focus on it, I can... overwrite everything about my own by just /knowing/ his. It doesn't feel like I'm me anymore.
: 've always been better at knowing an' being other people than... myself...
: ... that's... much stronger of a bond than it... really should be--

: ... mind if I try something? I just want to take a look at your static and see if I can read your soul code-- see what belongs to you and what's linked to him, maybe... don't know if it'd work, but--

tiny shrug. "... I've always been told to focus on other people's feelings. To know them better than my own. My own don't matter. I just need to be able to read. To understand. I don't... know who I am, anyway... so it's not hard to... be someone else. I guess. Um, okay, you can... do whatever you want."
